entry.title: The Accounts and Audit (Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Accounts and Audit Regulations 2003 (“the earlier Regulations”). They apply in England only.

entry.title: The Commission for Social Care Inspection (Explanation and Co-operation) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in relation to the functions of the Commission for Social Care Inspection (“the CSCI”) established pursuant to section 42 of the Health and Social Care (Community Health and Standards) Act 2003 (c. 43) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Teachers' Pensions (Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: Regulations 3 to 32 of these Regulations further amend the Teachers' Pensions Regulations 1997 (“the Principal Regulations”) which are the basis upon which the Teachers' Pension Scheme (“the Scheme”) operates. In addition to minor and drafting amendments and those which correct errors and statutory references, the following changes of substance are made.

entry.title: The Insolvency (Amendment) Rules 2004
entry.summary: These Rules make a number of amendments to the Insolvency Rules 1986 (S.I. 1986/1925) (“the 1986 Rules”).

entry.title: The Land Registration Fee Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order replaces the Land Registration Fee Order 2003. It makes changes to land registration fees.

entry.title: The Public Record Office (Fees) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke the Public Records Office (Fees) Regulations 2003 and prescribe a new range of fees to be charged for authentication of copies of records and for other services provided by the Public Record Office.

entry.title: The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Order 2004

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Order 2004

entry.summary: This Order is made as a consequence of a review under section 150 of the Social Security Administration Act 1992 (“the Administration Act”) and includes details of the sums mentioned in that section.

entry.title: Legal Aid (Financial Conditions) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Legal Aid, Advice and Assistance (Northern Ireland) Order 1981 so as to:

entry.title: Legal Advice and Assistance (Financial Conditions) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Legal Aid, Advice and Assistance (Northern Ireland) Order 1981 so as to:

entry.title: Legal Advice and Assistance (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Legal Advice and Assistance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1981 so as to substitute a new scale of contributions payable for legal advice and assistance under Article 7(2) of the Legal Aid, Advice and Assistance (Northern Ireland) Order 1981.

entry.title: The Nottinghamshire Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Sherwood Forest Hospitals National Health Service Trust and the Nottingham City Hospital National Health Service Trust, trust property held by the Nottinghamshire Healthcare National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedules of trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

title.div: The Education (Individual Pupil Information) (Prescribed Persons) (Wales) Regulations 2004 / Rheoliadau Addysg (Gwybodaeth am Ddisgyblion Unigol) (Personau Rhagnodedig) (Cymru) 2004

div.p: These Regulations revoke and replace the Education (Individual Pupil Information) (Prescribed Persons) (Wales) Regulations 1999.
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn dirymu ac yn disodli Rheoliadau Addysg (Gwybodaeth am Ddisgyblion Unigol) (Personau Rhagnodedig) (Cymru) 1999.

title.div: The Health Professions Wales (Transfer of Staff, Property, Rights and Liabilities) Order 2004 / Gorchymyn Proffesiynau Iechyd Cymru (Trosglwyddo Staff, Eiddo, Hawliau a Rhwymedigaethau) 2004

ukm:Subject.Value: HEALTH CARE AND ASSOCIATED PROFESSIONS, WALES

category.term: HEALTH CARE AND ASSOCIATED PROFESSIONS, WALES
PROFFESIYNAU GOFAL IECHYD A PHROFFESIYNAU CYSYLLTIEDIG, CYMRU

div.p: Health Professions Wales (“HPW”) is established by the Health Professions Wales (Establishment, Membership, Constitution and Functions) Order 2004 (S.I. 2004/551 (W.55)) for the purpose of undertaking functions on behalf of the National Assembly for Wales in relation to health care professions and health care support workers.

Sefydlir Proffesiynau Iechyd Cymru (“PIC”) gan Orchymyn Proffesiynau Iechyd Cymru (Sefydlu, Aelodaeth, Cyfansoddiad a Swyddogaethau) 2004 (O.S. 2004/551 (Cy.55)) at ddibenion ymgymryd â swyddogaethau ar ran Cynulliad Cenedlaethol Cymru mewn perthynas â'r proffesiynau gofal iechyd a gweithwyr cymorth gofal iechyd.

entry.title: The Insurers (Reorganisation and Winding Up) (Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations make a number of amendments to the Insurers (Reorganisation and Winding Up) Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004 No. 353). The first corrects an error in regulation 9 by inserting a specific date from which the obligation operates. The third makes clear that the expenses of the liquidation of all insurance companies are to rank before preferential debts. The other amendments correct three minor errors which could otherwise have affected the operation of those Regulations or other legislation amended by them.

title.div: The Miscellaneous Food Additives (Amendment) (Wales) Regulations 2004 / Rheoliadau Ychwanegion Bwyd Amrywiol (Diwygio) (Cymru) 2004

div.p: These Regulations, which apply to Wales only, amend the Miscellaneous Food Additives Regulations 1995, as already amended (“the principal Regulations”) which apply to the whole of Great Britain.
Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n gymwys i Gymru yn unig, yn diwygio Rheoliadau Ychwanegion Bwyd Amrywiol 1995, fel y'u diwygiwyd eisoes (“y prif Reoliadau”) sy'n gymwys i Brydain Fawr gyfan.

entry.title: Fisheries (Amendment) Byelaws (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Byelaws amend the Fisheries Byelaws (Northern Ireland) 2003.

entry.title: The Sea Fishing (Restriction on Days at Sea) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order amends the Sea Fishing (Restriction on Days at Sea) (Scotland) Order 2004 (“the principal Order”) to clarify and extend the legal effect of article 6(4) of the principal Order. Paragraph (4) of article 6 (use of regulated gear) of the principal Order is substituted by a new paragraph (4) which provides that any fishing boat which is present in the cod recovery zone carrying on board any regulated gear falling within any one of the groupings of regulated gear specified in paragraph 4 of Annex V to Council Regulation 2287/2003 may not simultaneously carry on board any regulated gear falling within any of the other groupings of regulated gear specified in paragraph 4 of Annex V. This provision enforces paragraph 8 of Annex V of Council Regulation 2287/2003 (article 2(2)). Article 6 of the principal Order makes provision only in relation to the carriage of regulated gear in the cod recovery zone (defined in paragraph 2 of Annex V of Council Regulation 2287/2003).

entry.title: The Commission for Healthcare Audit and Inspection (Explanation, Statements of Action and Co-operation) Regulations 2004

ukm:Subject.Value: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: NATIONAL HEALTH SERVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in relation to the functions of the Commission for Healthcare Audit and Inspection (“the CHAI”) established under section 41 of the Health and Social Care (Community Health and Standards) Bill 2003 (c. 43) (“the Act”).

entry.title: The Marketing and Use of Dangerous Substances Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations give effect to Commission Directive 2003/03 on blue colourant which adapts to technical progress for the twelfth time Council Directive 76/769/EEC on the approximation of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions of the Member States relating to restrictions on the marketing and use of certain dangerous substances and preparations.

title.div: The Jam and Similar Products (Wales) Regulations 2004 / Rheoliadau Cynhyrchion Jam a Chynhyrchion Tebyg (Cymru) 2004

div.p: These Regulations, which apply to Wales, implement Council Directive 2001/113/EC concerning fruit jams, jellies and marmalades and sweetened chestnut purée intended for human consumption (OJ No. L10, 12.1.2002, p.67) and also contain national measures. They revoke and replace the Jam and Similar Products Regulations 1981, as amended, in relation to Wales.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n gymwys i Gymru, yn gweithredu Cyfarwyddeb y Cyngor 2001/113/EC ynghylch jamiau ffrwythau, jelïau a marmaledau a phiwrî castan a felyswyd a fwriedir ar gyfer eu bwyta gan bobl (OJ Rhif L10, 12.1.2002, t.67) ac maent yn cynnwys mesurau cenedlaethol hefyd. Maent yn dirymu ac yn disodli Rheoliadau Cynhyrchion Jam a Chynhyrchion Tebyg 1981, fel y'u diwygiwyd, mewn perthynas â Chymru.
